00285 
00286 void printmenu(int* i)
00287 {
00288         printf("\n\t\tMAIN MENU\n\nEnter 0 to auto connect and authenticate \nEnter 1 to Connect\nEnter 2 to Authenticate\nEnter 3 to Set\nEnter 4 to Get\nEnter 5 for Query\nEnter 6 to Disconnect\nEnter 7 to Exit\nEnter 8 To add in census\n--------------------------------------------\n\n");
00289         printf("Please enter a command number: ");
00290         int valid = 0;
00291         char* str[100];
00292 
00293         do{
00294                 fgets(str, 100, stdin); // read in 100 chars from one line
00295                 valid = sscanf(str, "%d", i);   // read in the integer into the variable i. Doing so also updates the i in main since we pass it in as a pointer reference
00296                 printf("\n");
00297 
00298                 if(!valid)      // check whether the input was numerical or not
00299                         printf("Please enter a numerical value for the command: ");
00300 
00301                 else if((*i<0) || (*i>8))       // we also have to check whether the numerical input was one of the 7 options
00302                 {
00303                         printf("%d\n", *i);
00304                         printf("Please enter a value between 1 and 7: ");
00305                         valid = 0;
00306                 }
00307 
00308         }while(!valid); // loops based on the validity of valid. If the prompt was one of the commands, valid stays 0 and continues our do while..
00309 }
